intro: Gerardia divaricata, commonly known as the variable gerardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Gerardia divaricata produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
